Reviews.Content: Hotel does not exist Anymore I went to this hotel yesterday, but apparently it is not in service anymore, yet the Name is still on Top of the Building. We called the 1 -800 number but the customer rep didn't bother to tell us this. He gave us another hotel name to contact.
Reviews.Author: phlinq

Reviews.Content: Old but very good price and location I stayed on the Bamer a lot of times, it has an excellent location and the views from top floors are amazing. The building is very old, but today is in a complete renovation. The price is good, 45 -50 USD by a single room. Very recommended to tourists and groups.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: great location Great location, across street from Rivera mural, near Bella Artes, Beautiful Alemeda Park, short walk to Zocolo, two metro lines.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Best buy at the Bamer After 11 vacations in Mexico City I chose the Bamer for its location. It is across the street from the Alameda, Mexico City's Central Park, and adjacent to Bellas Artes, places of culture and history. All within walking distance. Can be noisy due to location on a main avenue. Good size rooms. Mine had jacuzzi and refrigerator, Clean. Polite staff. Best prices in town.
Reviews.Author: OLDABBA

Reviews.Content: Great memories of this place! We had a great time in this hotel. During the 1970s, this hotel was clearly very plush. However, it suffered the effects of an earthquake and now everything wobbles a bit! But if you're young, want to see Mexico City, stay somewhere fairly OK and cheap, then who cares? Rooms are huge, fairly clean, and room staff are very good). Water is hot in the morning if you check in the previous evening ! The staff are very helpful, friendly and great fun. Reception staff seem to double up as lift staff, room service staff, etc.! Something odd happened to the guy in the adjacent room one night, and the hotel manager and his assistant knocked on our door at 3am and asked if we minded if they could walk through and enter the room by our adjoining door! This was very strange, we never found out the reason (but have enjoyed speculating about it!), and we have dined out on this story for a long while.It is a bit David Lynch (see previous commentator), but it was a great experience!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Hope you like David Lynch films Didn't stay here but did look at a couple of the rooms. They were large with very aged, Blue Velvet-esque decor. Intriguing but not exactly welcoming. Though it may well have been clean, the place seemed dusty- perhaps because of the huge ( noisy) demolition project next door (as of 05/03.) Otherwise location was good, across from the Alameda and very close to the centro historico.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Really nice 1950 style hotel I loved this place, . Rooms are clean big and nice, a bit loud during the day if your room overlooks the park otherwise OK,
